generations.originalPrompt:
Metallice Master of Puppets
 Main Riff

proDescription.sound_description: Highly aggressive and tight with pronounced attack, palm-muted percussiveness, thick midrange, high clarity, and minimal ambience. The tone is dry, razor-sharp, and extremely articulate, emphasizing fast alternate picking and heavy riffing.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: Used to tightly control unwanted noise and hum, crucial for palm-muted clarity and tight stops. Compressor: Not used, as natural dynamics and attack are preferred. Overdrive/Distortion: High-gain distortion pedal (like a Tube Screamer or Boss SD-1) as a boost in front of a high-gain amp, adding bite, tightening bass, and increasing sustain. Amplifier: High-gain tube amplifier (Mesa/Boogie Mark IIC+ or similar) set for aggressive, saturated distortion with a pronounced midrange and tight low end. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with Celestion speakers for punch and projection. EQ: Graphic EQ (optional) for further sculpting—slightly scooped mids, tight low end, and clear top end. Modulation: Not used. Delay: Not used. Reverb: Not used, as a dry sound is essential for tightness and definition.
proDescription.additional_info: Use bridge humbucker pickup for maximum attack. Heavier string gauges (e.g., .010-.046 or heavier) for tightness. Aggressive right-hand palm-muting and alternate picking. Downpicking technique is essential for authenticity. No effects in the effects loop; all effects are placed before the amp input.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers

proDescription.sound_description: Clean, warm, chiming tone with a slight vintage character. The sound is dynamic, open, and has a touch of airiness, with subtle breakup when picking hard. Not overly bright or harsh, retaining a smooth and laid-back vibe.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: not used (the tone is clean and dynamic, so gating is unnecessary). Compressor: used subtly to even out picking dynamics and add sustain, but set to preserve natural feel. Overdrive/distortion/boost: not used (the amp provides all necessary breakup). Amplifier: vintage-style clean combo amp (e.g., Fender Twin Reverb or similar), set just at the edge of breakup for a touch of warmth and sparkle. Cabinet: matching 2x12 or 4x10 open-back cab, chosen for its airy and present top-end. EQ: used for slight mid-scooping and to roll off excessive highs, keeping the tone smooth. Modulation: not used. Delay: not used. Reverb: spring reverb from the amp, set for a subtle ambient wash.
references: Red Hot Chili Peppers - Scar Tissue
proDescription.additional_info: Single-coil pickups (preferably bridge or neck/middle positions on a Stratocaster), light to moderate picking, light string gauge (e.g., .009–.042), use of fingers or very light pick attack for phrasing nuance.

realRig.cabinet: Fender Twin Reverb 2x12 open-back with Jensen C12K speakers

proDescription.sound_description: Aggressive, tight, mid-focused, high-gain rhythm tone with solid low end, pronounced attack, clear articulation, and a slight sense of space.
proDescription.guitar_rig_description: Noise gate: used to control unwanted hiss and maintain tightness between palm-muted chugs. Compressor: not used. Overdrive/boost: a classic overdrive pedal placed before the amp, set for low drive and high level, to tighten the low end and add attack. Distortion: comes primarily from the high-gain amplifier. Amplifier: a high-gain tube amp head (e.g., Mesa/Boogie or Marshall) set for saturated rhythm crunch, with pronounced mids and tight bass. Cabinet: 4x12 closed-back cabinet with vintage-voiced speakers, mic’d with a dynamic microphone close to the cone for punch. EQ: optional post-amp EQ to cut excessive low end and add a touch of upper mids for clarity. Modulation: not used. Delay: not used. Reverb: subtle room reverb or short plate, just enough to prevent dryness but not to wash out the tight riffing.
proDescription.additional_info: Bridge humbucker pickup, palm-muting technique for chugs, medium to heavy gauge strings (10-46 or thicker) for tight response, aggressive right-hand picking.

realRig.cabinet: Mesa/Boogie Rectifier Standard 4x12 Cabinet with Celestion Vintage 30 speakers

noise_gate.Threshold: just above amp noise floor (start at 11 o'clock)

reverb.Type: Short plate or small room (amp built-in or pedal)
